question: 点滴
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Point</kanji> <kanji>drip</kanji>s are drips coming down little by little. These are the drips of an <vocabulary>intravenous drip</vocabulary>. Back in the day this was a way of talking about <vocabulary>raindrops</vocabulary>, or really any <vocabulary>falling drops of water</vocabulary>. But nowadays we only use it for IV drips.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
